title.narrative: WASH OP 5 - Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) IN EMERGENCIES

description.narrative: Population affected by emergencies have access to water, improved sanitation facilities and appropriate hygiene practices (hand washing with soap and household water treatment)., which contributes to Sanitation, Sanitation (Covid), Wash And Emergencies. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By the end of 2020, households and communities have access to safe drinking water, sanitation, and healthy environments and good hygiene practices are equitably improved in target regions

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Population affected by emergencies have access to water, improved sanitation facilities and appropriate hygiene practices (handwashing with soap and household water treatment).

description.narrative: The year was marked by three main hazards:;floods, drought and the COVID-19 pandemic, during which UNICEF provided effective WASH responses to 2,069,204 people by ensuring they have access hygiene promotion and supplies (specially soap and handwashing, campaign and disinfection to support public places and transport etc.), drinking water (924,202 people from the total above), basic sanitation facilities (7,148 people from the total above).; When compared to the entire cluster response, the UNICEF contribution is estimated at around 70%. The effectiveness of responses provided by the WASH cluster during COVID-19 crisis helped to raise the WASH sector profile.; | Status:Met | As-of Date:12/01/2021
